meanings.definition: The branch of biology that deals with the relations of organisms to one another and to their physical surroundings.
meanings.sent1: Studying ecology helps us understand how living things interact with their environment.
meanings.sent2: Ecology is crucial for scientists to learn about the connections between different organisms.
meanings.sent3: In the world of ecology, even the tiniest bug plays a big role in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent4: The web of ecology weaves together all living beings like a intricate tapestry.
meanings.sent5: Ecology paints a picture of the delicate balance in nature.

meanings.definition: The political movement that seeks to protect the environment, especially from pollution and other harmful effects of human activity.
meanings.sent1: Many people join ecology groups to help keep our planet clean and safe.
meanings.sent2: Ecology advocates work hard to ensure that our environment remains healthy for future generations.
meanings.sent3: Joining the ecology movement means standing up for the well-being of our Earth.
meanings.sent4: The fight for ecology is a battle for the preservation of our natural world.
meanings.sent5: Ecology warriors defend our planet from harm with passion and dedication.
